rmp
Class JxtaReliableMcastChannel

java.lang.Object
  rmp.JxtaReliableMcastChannel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, net.jxta.pipe.PipeMsgListener, java.lang.Runnable
public class JxtaReliableMcastChannel
extends java.lang.Object
implements net.jxta.pipe.PipeMsgListener, java.lang.Runnable

Title: Reliable Multicast Pipes

Description: :
The connections between the nodes of the multicast tree of the channel that are used for exchanging messages, are implemented with JxtaBiDiPipes in both directions. That's it, a node has :
* a JxtaBiDiPipe for talking-listening to/from his parent and
* a Vector of JxtaBiDiPipes for talking - listening his children
This class has 2 main responsibilities :
a)To listen to our node's parent for messages that might be of one of the following message types : bulk data / NACK / retransmission / closure.
After the reception of such messeges the channel takes the appropriate actions.
b)To forward the messages that we receive (from our oun parent) to the nodes (our children) that are directly attached to us.
While this sequence of actions (listening to parent node - forwarding to our children) is taking place, every channel is performing some addtional tasks underneath like sending events to the attached listeners, asking for retransmissions from the parent, processing NACK messages etc. in a non transparent way for the node and the user of the RMS service.

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2005

Company: JXTA ORG

private static int BUFFSIZE
          The maximum size of the message buffer of the node for the channel.
private  java.util.Vector cachedProviders
          This vector contains the Providers that did respond to the Join Request Message when we firslty joined the channel, and we have to keep them (although only one is used) in the case that the local node unexpectedly disconnects from its parent.

          The running thread for accepting new children bidi connections.

private static final int ROOTBUFFSIZE

See Also:
Constant Field Values

desired_seq_num

private int desired_seq_num
The sequence number of the message that the local node expects to receive, so that we have inorder receptions. E.g. if we have received messages with seq_nums : 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 9, 12 the desired_seq_num will normally be 5 for the next reception.

is_first_message

private boolean is_first_message
This boolean variable is set to "TRUE" if we firstly receive a message after our join to the channel. It is the starting point for everyone as no late joins is supported.

BUFFSIZE

private static final int BUFFSIZE
The maximum size of the message buffer of the node for the channel.
Notice tha it is a lot smaller than the buffersize of the Root node of the channel.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

WINDOW_SIZE

private static final int WINDOW_SIZE
The maximum number of non desired messages (out of sequence) that a node can receive from its parent. If this threshold is exceeded then a NACK for the desired message is sent to the node's provider (parent).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

undesirable_msg_arrivals

private int undesirable_msg_arrivals
The current number of non desired messages (out of sequence) that the node has received from its parent.

message_buffer

private java.util.Vector message_buffer
The buffer where the incoming messages [data] from our parent arrive to and stored until they are reliably transmitted to next hop.

The registered JxtaReliableMcastService's JxtaReliableEventListeners.

The running thread for accepting new children bidi connections. (if local node is a Provider or Root)

Method Detail

createPipeAdv

private net.jxta.protocol.PipeAdvertisement createPipeAdv(ChannelProvider provd)
It creates a PipeAdvertisement using the information of the ChannelProvider of the parameter. It is only called from within function prepare_channel().

Parameters:
provd - ChannelProvider
Returns:
PipeAdvertisement

prepare_channel

public void prepare_channel()
It prepares the bidi connections of the node that has joined (or created) to a (the) channel.
## If node is a Provider,
it means that it hasn't received yet any responses for the "Join Channel Request Message" that JxtaReliableMcastService sent and the vector cachedProviders is empty.
Now it has to create the JxtaServerPipe so that it can accept secure connection requests from the future children.
## else (the node is not a provider)
get the first element-object of cachedProviders Vector , and use it to create the PipeAdvertisement of our provider's JxtaServerPipe. Then, the node tries to connect to the provider using the previously created pipeadvertisement [the adv also exists in the Vector].
The node keeps the rest of the objects inside the cachedProviders Vector for future failover purposes.

run

public void run()
If the node is a provider of the channel, it has to wait for incoming bidi connections from other nodes (the children). It is sure that our JxtaReliableMcastService has previously sent a Join Response Message to the nodes that will try to establish a connection.
It is possible for the node to reach the maximum allowed number of attached children and so, it has to reject the incoming connections until a position is released.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

pipeMsgEvent

public void pipeMsgEvent(net.jxta.pipe.PipeMsgEvent event)
Called every time a message reception from our parent occurs and we have to place it in the buffer + forward it to our children. It is also possible to receive a NACK message from an attached child. This event can occur after message reception either from our parent_BiDi or from one JxtaBiDiPipe in chld_BiDiPipes.

Specified by:
pipeMsgEvent in interface net.jxta.pipe.PipeMsgListener
Parameters:
event - PipeMsgEvent

determine_msg_type

private int determine_msg_type(net.jxta.endpoint.MessageElement msgElement)
It determines the type of the message based on the contents of the relevant MessageElement.

Parameters:
msgElement - MessageElement The MessageElement of the received message that holds the message type
Returns:
int A unique integer that identifies the type :
MSG_BULK -> 1
MSG_RETR -> 2
MSG_CLOSE_CHANNEL -> 3
MSG_NACK -> 4

processDataMessage

private void processDataMessage(net.jxta.endpoint.Message msg)
This function is called automatically when the joined (to the channel) node receives a message with type MSG_BULK from its provider (parent).

Parameters:
msg - Message The received message that holds the data.

Parameters:
msg - Message The received closure message.

                           int new_seq_num)
Places the given message (msg param) with sequence number new_seq_num in the right position inside the buffer for the received messages "message_buffer".

Parameters:
msg - Message The message that we want to store.
new_seq_num - int The sequence number of the message that we want to store.

private void forward_message_to_children(net.jxta.endpoint.Message msg)

Parameters:
msg - Message The Message that will be forwarded.

send

public void send(java.lang.String data)
          throws RMSException
This is a public method that can be used outside JxtaReliableMcastChannel to send data in the form of a String. Of course, only the node that created the channel (the Root) can use that method, else a RMSException is thrown.

Parameters:
data - String
Throws:
RMSException

addRMSEventListener

public void addRMSEventListener(JxtaReliableEventListener listener)
Registers a JxtaReliableEventListener.

The listener is invoked when:

  • A bulk data message is received from our parent, and it has the desired sequence number.
  • A closure message is received from our parent.

    • Parameters:
    listener - JxtaReliableEventListener : The filter which will be called.

removeJxtaRMSEventListener

public void removeJxtaRMSEventListener(JxtaReliableEventListener listener)
Unregisters a JxtaReliableEventListener.

Parameters:
listener - JxtaReliableEventListener

sendJxtaRMSEvent

private void sendJxtaRMSEvent(JxtaReliableEvent e)
It generates the occurance of an RMStEvent for every registered JxtaReliableEventListener so that it is possible to deliver the received message from our parent.

Parameters:
e - JxtaReliableEvent

Parameters:
msg - Message The received message that has to be delivered to the node - user.
